alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:01AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Clarendon and southwestern Sumter Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 200 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Summerton, or 9 miles west of Manning, moving east at 55 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manning, Summerton, Alcolu, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Turbeville, Pinewood, Paxville, St. Paul, Central Crossroads, Brogdon, Lakewood, Privateer, Foreston, Gable and Davis Station. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 103 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for central South Carolina.
